item.title: Lúcio Ability Overview | Overwatch

meta.summary:
b"Come on, lets bring it together: http://blizz.ly/MeetLucio

Growing up in one of Rio de Janeiro's favelas, Lcio initially turned to music as a way to lift people's spirits and help them rebuild as a community in the wake of the Omnic Crisis. Now an international celebrity, Lcio seeks to inspire positive social change through his music and fights to make the world a better place.

On the battlefield, Lcios cutting-edge Sonic Amplifier buffets enemies with projectiles and knocks foes back with blasts of sound. He also plays two different songsone to heal his team and the other to boost their movement speedand uses his Crossfade technique to switch between them at will. And when the going gets especially rough, Lcio will drop the beat, activating a temporary Sound Barrier to shield all nearby allies.

Sign Up for Beta: http://bit.ly/JoinOverwatch 
Like Us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/playoverwatch 
Follow Us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/playoverwatch"

item.title: Overwatch: The COMPLETE Lucio Mastery Guide

meta.summary:
b"Lucio has been a mainstay in pro play for a long long time so today we have mad an entire mastery advanced guide for you! Unlocking his power comes with a lot of mechanical skill as well as gamesense making him to be one of the highest potential skill cap heroes in the game in our estimation. Boop, barrier and blast your way to victory with Lucio, the hero that enables Overwatch play in a way no other hero can! *Recent pro meta trends indicate that his pickrate is plummeting in the Mercy meta, however upon careful VoD reviews of these pro games the gap of Lucio's absence shines through and we believe there will be a resurgence of Lucio picks when pros realize the speed boost utility is a must-have on some attacking maps especially. A controversial opinion atm, but one that we think will be proven correct with enough trial and error on this new mercy patch. If you enjoyed the video, be sure to leave it a like! 

Subscribe here - http://bit.ly/2aN1OuO

item.title: 5 Basic Lucio Tips You NEED To Know | Overwatch

meta.summary:
b"Lucio, despite his reputation of being a simple hero, is probably one of the most under-utilized characters in this game, despite his high pickrate. 

Pro Players have long figured out how to play Lucio properly, but on ladder, too many players are fine with being healbots. It's like they don't even know how to do wallriding. 

So today, I decided to give you guys 5 Basic Lucio Tips That You NEED To Know. Wondering about the jump keybind and Lucio Controls? I got you covered!
Need wallride tips or a wall riding guide? We got this, too!
Lucio Tips and Trick aplenty to make sure that YOU are ready for your next Ranked Match. 

I present to you: Starting Point ft. Lucio.

item.title: Lucio Wallriding Guide: The Basics of Being Ridiculously Fast (Some Tech Outdated, check comments)

meta.summary:
b"Got a lot of people requesting this, hope it helps!
Click read more for a bunch of information and links. CHECK COMMENTS GUYS




Impractical Rollouts: https://youtu.be/EfhmMBQdNK4
Nulljumping Guide: https://youtu.be/9ZVC-iT90A0
Awesome Lucio guide that covers literally everything about lucio, made by speedboop: https://pastebin.com/SZ5ZdTHP https://pastebin.com/BrVBTjTM https://pastebin.com/2GEu6E5c
Awesome subreddit to find rollouts: https://www.reddit.com/r/LucioRollouts/
Text Version of Video:

Settings: Crossfade - spacebar
Amp it up - shift
Jump - right click and mousewheeldown
Boop - anything thats comfortable for you

Custom Game Settings:
Hero Respawn Scalar: 0%
Amp it up cooldown time: 0%
Ultimate generation: 500%
Modes: Skirmish

Wallskimming
Spam space/right click or scroll your mousewheel while skimming by the edge of a wall. The more you chain, the more speed you gain. Slamming into a wall directly will make you lose speed. If you don't feel like you're getting enough speed, spam faster.

Airstrafing
Press WA and move mouse to the left while in the air to move left.
Press WD and move mouse to the right while in the air to move right. Use this in order to skim walls instead of crashing into them.

Where to look:
Looking up gets you more height, looking down gets you less.

Bhopping:
Scroll right before you hit the ground or spam your jump button. This allows you to jump on the ground and keep all speed boost/momentum you already have. If jumping on a downward slope, you gain speed depending on how high you jumped from. The higher you fell, the more speed you gain. Bhopping on an upward slope will make you lose ALL your speed."
